alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 3:47PM PST until December 09 at 11:44AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .Heavy rain yesterday through today and the additional rainfall overnight will drive the lower Chehalis River above flood stage tomorrow morning. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Porter...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River at Porter. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 49.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood pasture lands and many roads...including SR 12 between Oakville and Rochester. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 45.3 feet. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 49.4 feet Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1230 AM PST.
